poem:
Title: In Shattered Lands

War in Sana'a - echoes of pain, 
Unfed in hospitals - lined again.
Sanctions – a cruel-noosed reign.
No anaesthesia for the mundane,
The shattered glass of a world insane.
Winds of imposed winter, hold no bane,
On UK-US, distant, humane.

In Gaza, Tel Aviv - same disdain,
Day ticks on to refrain,
A bleak parchment of sun's wane.
